We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has retinal hemorrhages, which suggest cytomegalovirus (CMV) retinitis, a common condition in untreated HIV patients. The drug mentioned in the question that directly inhibits viral DNA polymerases by binding to pyrophosphate-binding sites is ganciclovir, used to treat CMV retinitis. Ganciclovir can cause hypocalcemia, which may have led to the patient's seizure. Demyelination is not associated with either CMV retinitis or ganciclovir. Hypoglycemia and lactic acidosis are also not commonly associated with ganciclovir treatment.
